The 'European Theatre of World War II', also known as the 'European War', was a
huge area of heavy fighting across Europe from Germany's invasion of Poland on
September 1, 1939 until the end of the war with the German unconditional
surrender on May 8, 1945 (V-E Day). The Allied forces fought the Axis powers on
two fronts (the Eastern Front and Western Front) as well as in the adjoining
Mediterranean and Middle East Theatre.
categories: European theatre of World War II|
headings: Germany assumes dominance in northern Europe
End of the war in Europe
